page.title: 01Halesowen Landscape
page.content: Halesowen is a town of many contrasts. It has rural,green belt, industrial and residential areas. The centre is sited in a valley. Today it is a large shopping centre. To the East and West sides are residential areas with recreation grounds and a variety of schools. To the south are the rural and green belt areas including farms, a golf club, riding stables, and an Athletics and Cycling club built on the grounds of the famous Manor Abbey Ruins. In contrast the industrial area spreads across the North East side of Halesowen, the main industry being the iron production and associated products. However many of Halesowen's old factories are now derelict.{ {
